description: South Africa completed a historic tour, recording only their second Test series victory in India — and their first since the iconic 2000 triumph under Hansie Cronje. The result also marked India’s biggest defeat by runs in Test cricket, adding further weight to an already bruising outcome. The impact was immediate in the WTC table.

They are calling for an urgent overhaul of the team's strategy, citing issues like excessive all-rounder selection and constant team changes. This marks a significant decline in India's home Test performance.

title: ‘Serious security breach’: EC writes to Kolkata Police; seeks 48-hour action report
description: The Election Commission of India has expressed serious concern over the safety of poll officials in West Bengal following a security breach at the Chief Electoral Officer's office. The ECI has directed Kolkata Police to ensure immediate safety measures for officials at their offices, residences, and during travel, citing the sensitivity of upcoming elections.

description: A rare first-edition 1939 Superman comic book, discovered in a family attic, has shattered records by selling for over $9 million. This unrestored, high-grade copy, found by three brothers while clearing out their late mother's belongings, is now the most expensive comic ever sold, highlighting its cultural significance and pristine condition.

South Africa create history: First Test series win in India in 25 years
description: South Africa registered a massive 408-run victory over India in the second Test, securing a 2-0 series sweep. Spinner Simon Harmer's exceptional 6-wicket haul dismantled India's batting for 140, marking India's heaviest Test defeat by runs and South Africa's first series win in India in 25 years. Marco Jansen was named player of the match for his all-round performance.

While admitting collective failure, he highlighted past successes and stated his future rests with the BCCI. Gambhir defended his selection strategy, emphasising tough characters over flair for Test cricket.

Built with an investment of ₹1,300 crore, the centre will service LEAP engines used in Airbus A320neo and Boeing 737 MAX aircraft. Operational by 2026, the facility will support India’s growing aviation sector, generate skilled jobs, and boost indigenous MRO capabilities, positioning India as a global aviation hub.

He was taken to rented rooms where explosives were stored and to his university accommodation, believed to be the plot's nerve center. Investigators are probing the doctors' alleged links to handlers in Pakistan and Turkey.

title: Pune airport chaos: Pilot refuses to fly plane to Delhi; cites duty-time cap
description: Over 100 Delhi-bound flyers faced a three-hour delay at Pune airport Tuesday morning after an IndiGo captain refused to fly due to flight duty time limitations. An Amritsar-bound IndiGo flight also experienced a similar delay for the same reason. Passengers expressed frustration over the lack of prior information and airline planning.

title: Mosques take mic: In UP, imams lead the charge to help Muslims navigate SIR confusion
description: Across Muslim-majority neighbourhoods, this new civic refrain has become familiar. Officials say it is a routine update ahead of the 2027 assembly elections. But in neighbourhoods bruised by anxieties around CAA and NRC, the exercise is filled with anxiety.

title: Amazon to employees: No new third-party AI tools; pushes for house instead
description: Amazon has directed its software engineers to avoid using third-party AI coding tools like OpenAI's Codex and Anthropic's Claude Code, instead use its proprietary system, Kiro. This strategic move aims to bolster Amazon's competitive standing against rivals OpenAI and Google in the rapidly expanding AI code assistant market.
